subject: AI & Agents
title: Deepfakes and Trust Erosion
description: A 60-second lesson on Deepfakes and Trust Erosion.

hook.text: A video of a world leader declaring war goes viral. It looks flawless. It's completely fake.

buildup.text: Deepfake technology generates realistic video, audio, and images of people saying things they never said.

discovery.text: The threat isn't just fake content â€” it's the erosion of trust in all content. Anything could be fake.

twist.text: Detection tools exist, but they're always one step behind the generators in an arms race.

climax.text: Digital signatures and provenance tracking may become essential infrastructure for trust in the AI era.

punchline.text: When anything can be faked, trust becomes the scarcest resource.

quiz.question: What is the broader threat of deepfakes beyond fake content?
options: They erode trust in all content, since anything could be fabricated
